title: 'Personalise' to help boost corporate sales
text:
Save 
The boss of Travel Counsellors has urged the company’s business travel specialists to focus on personalisation, branding it the “key to success in today’s industry”. 
Managing director Steve Byrne told delegates at the recent ﻿Business Travel mini conference the company had seen significant growth in its business travel arm, as he revealed plans to renew the company’s focus on building its corporate travel division. 
“We believe there is significant scope to grow in the corporate market,” he said. 
“As a business, our customer satisfaction and repeat business rates are high and SME penetration is low, so the upside potential is considerable. 
Our highly relational business model, which focuses on delivering the best levels of bespoke and personal service to clients, has never been more relevant in the corporate travel space.” 
Guest speaker Paul Wait, chief executive of the GTMC, also highlighted the importance of personalisation, as he revealed that one of the top travel management priorities for 2015 was “traveller satisfaction”. 
Some 91% of senior decision makers said it was important to have a strategic partnership with their travel management company. 
Meanwhile, Byrne urged corporate travel agents to use the client data and management information available to them, to boost their business and be pro-active in both gaining new corporate customers and keeping close to them. 
He added that data-driven businesses outperformed industry peers by up to 6% and were up to 26% more profitable. 
“We are constantly looking at ways in which we can further enhance the information you have available to you so that you grasp the opportunities to build your business,” he said. 
“We’ll continue to invest in the support, tools, management information and technology to make sure you flourish in today’s market place.”
